entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles, Denture, Hearing Aid (CBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance shall be granted to the workers who are registered under the CBOCWWB for the purchase of Spectacles, Denture and Hearing Aid.

fields.schemeName: Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Outstanding Performance in Sports and Games for the Year
fields.briefDescription: The award is given to the sportspersons of Odisha who have achieved outstanding performance in any of the recognized sports during the year making the State of Odisha and India proud.

fields.schemeName: Interest Free Loan (CBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, interest free loan shall be granted to the registered construction workers of the Board for the purchase of items like Fridge, Television/ LCD, Motor Cycle/Scooter, Cooler, Fan & Bicycle.

fields.schemeName: AICTE-ISTE INDUCTION/REFRESHER PROGRAMME SCHEME
fields.briefDescription: AICTE-ISTE Induction/ Refresher Programme provide financial assistance to AICTE approved institutions/universities in conducting training for the teaching faculties working in technical institutions.

fields.schemeName: Supply of Dhotis and Sarees to Scheduled Caste (SC) People
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Supply of Dhotis and Sarees to Scheduled Caste (SC) People” by the Adi Dravidar Welfare and Scheduled Tribes Welfare Department, Union Territory of Puducherry is introduced to provide clothing items (lungi, shirt, saree, blouse, etc) to the Scheduled Caste (SC) people of Puducherry.

fields.schemeName: Free Supply of Sarees and Dhothies to the Poor People
fields.briefDescription: The scheme was introduced to provide two sets of clothing items to poor people (other than SC/Fisherman) once in a year as a measure of Social Security. The beneficiaries are identified based on the data from the Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs Department in Puducherry.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Old Age Pensioner Suffering From TB/ Cancer
fields.briefDescription: “Financial Assistance to Old Age Pensioner Suffering From TB/ Cancer” by the Dept of Women & Child Development, Govt of Puducherry, was introduced to extend a helping hand by way of financial assistance to Old Age/Destitute Pensioners who are suffering from TB/Cancer to meet the medical expenses.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Pensioners Suffering From HIV and AIDS
fields.briefDescription: “Financial Assistance to Pensioners Suffering From HIV/AIDS” is a Social Security Scheme by the Department of Women, Child Development & Social Security, Government of Jharkhand which aims to provide social security through financial assistance to those persons who are suffering from HIV/AIDS.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Funeral Rites
fields.briefDescription: “Financial Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Funeral Rites” was introduced by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Department, Government of Puducherry. The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to the Scheduled Caste family for performing funeral rites of their deceased family member.

fields.schemeName: Shauchalaya Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Shauchalaya Sahayata Yojana" is a scheme by the government of Uttar Pradesh, India, to provide financial assistance to registered construction workers to build toilets in their homes.

fields.schemeName: Promotion Of Intensive Aquaculture Through Introduction Of Bio-floc Technology During The Year 2021-22
fields.briefDescription: The government of Odisha introduced Bio-floc-based farming and aims to promote sustainable intensification of freshwater fish and brackish water shrimp farming for boosting productivity and generating high income in a limited area.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Freeship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The West Bengal Freeship Scheme (WBFS)has been launched by the Department of Higher Education,  Government of West Bengal. This freeship would be provided as a tuition fee waiver for the under Graduate students level in Engineering & Technology/ Pharmacy/ Architecture.

fields.schemeName: Atal Shresth Shahar Yojna
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to reward and incentivize the best performing Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) in Himachal Pradesh (Municipal Council/Nagar Panchyat) on the indicators of sanitations/cleanliness, increase utilization, public infrastructure and official work.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Benefit (A.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Maternity Benefit” was started by the Assam Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (A.B.O.C.W.W.B), Labour Welfare Department, Government of Assam for providing financial assistance to the registered women beneficiaries as maternity benefits during the period of maternity.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance (A.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Marriage Assistance” was started by the Assam Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (A.B.O.C.W.W.B), Labour Welfare Department, Government of Assam for providing financial assistance to the registered construction workers for the marriage of their children.

fields.schemeName: Kisan Vikas Patra Scheme
fields.briefDescription: ‘Kisan Vikas Patra Scheme’ was relaunched in the year 2014 by the Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry Of Finance, Government of India in view of the popular demand and to revitalize Small Savings. The amount invested in Kisan Vikas Patra (KYP) doubles in 115 months at the present rate.

fields.schemeName: Spices Development Ginger, Turmeric, Black Pepper, Cardamom, Coriander, Cinnamon and Chillies
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to encourage farmers to produce good quality and diseased-free planting materials and to grow improved varieties of high-yielding spices.

fields.schemeName: Tuber Crops Potato, Tapioca, Colocasia
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to boost up production and productivity of potato per unit area by providing quality HYV seeds, and equipment at a 50% subsidy.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Financial Assistance to Differently Abled Person
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Grant of Financial Assistance to Differently Abled Person” by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry was introduced to provide monthly financial assistance to Persons with Disability to maintain their minimum standard of living.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
fields.schemeName: Consortia & Tender Marketing Scheme
fields.briefDescription:
Micro & Small Enterprise in their Individual Capacity faces problems to procure and execute large order, which inhibit and
restrict their growth. NSIC accordingly, adopts Consortia approach and forms consortia of units manufacturing the same
products, thereby easing out marketing problems of MSEs.

fields.schemeName: Funeral Assistance (A.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance shall be given to the nominees/dependents of a deceased registered worker, towards funeral expenses.

fields.schemeName: Home for the Aged and Infirm
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Home for the Aged and Infirm" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The objective of this scheme is to cater to the needs of persons who are aged/infirm, i.e. senior citizens, both male and female above the age of 60 years from BPL Family.

fields.schemeName: Government Special School for the Visually Handicapped and the Hearing Impaired
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Government Special School for the Visually Handicapped and the Hearing Impaired” by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry, was introduced to facilitate the education and self-confidence development of visually impaired and hearing-impaired children.

fields.schemeName: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for the Wards of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles
fields.briefDescription: The scheme was introduced by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India from the academic year 2006-07 to encourage higher technical & professional education for the dependent wards & widows of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles (CAPFs & AR) Personnel.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Fuel Subsidy to Differently Abled Persons Who Are Owning Motorised Vehicles
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Grant of Fuel Subsidy to Differently Abled Persons Who Are Owning Motorised Vehicles” by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry was introduced to provide a subsidy of upto 50 % of the cost of fuel to persons with disability who own motorised vehicles.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Transport Allowance to Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Grant of Transport Allowance to Differently Abled Persons" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. In this scheme, a fixed sum ₹ 300/- per month shall be paid as Transport Allowance to the differently abled individuals.

fields.schemeName: Free Distribution of Rice to Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Free Distribution of Rice to Differently Abled Persons” by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry was introduced to distribute 15 Kg of rice per month or equivalent Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the differently abled persons.

fields.schemeName: Development of Strawberry Cultivation
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide farmers with quality and improved varieties of strawberry planting materials so as to encourage area expansion under this crop such that commercialization horticulture under this crop is achieved.

fields.schemeName: Masala Shetra Vistar Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Masala Shetra Vistar Yojana was launched by the Government of Madhya Pradesh the whose objective is to expand the area and increase the production of selected spice crops through quality high yielding varieties.

fields.schemeName: Sabji Shetra Vistar Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under the Sabji Shetra Vistar yojana, selection of vegetables through quality high yielding varieties to expand the area of crops and increase production.

fields.schemeName: “Home for the Aged" under Grant-in-Aid to Pondicherry Society for the Care of the Aged (PONCARE)
fields.briefDescription: Through the scheme “Home for the Aged", the senior citizens are provided with stay at subsidiary rates, food (both vegetarian and non-vegetarian), routine health check up by doctors thrice in a week, providing news papers and television for entertainment.

fields.schemeName: “Medical Camps (Allopathy and Indian systems of Medicine)" under Grant-in-Aid to Pondicherry Society for the Care of the Aged (PONCARE)
fields.briefDescription: “Medical Camps (Allopathy and Indian systems of Medicine)" under the umbrella scheme "Grant-in-Aid to Pondicherry Society for the Care of the Aged" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The senior citizens are provided free health checkups and free medicines.

fields.schemeName: “Family Counseling" under Grant-in-Aid to Pondicherry State Social Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: “Family Counseling" under the umbrella scheme "Grant-in-Aid to Pondicherry State Social Welfare Board" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. Through this scheme, the residents of Puducherry are provided with counselling, rehabilitative and referral services.

fields.schemeName: Integrated Agriculture Training Centre Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide training for enhancing the skills of farmers besides imparting updated agricultural technologies to departmental functionaries.

fields.schemeShortTitle: CHIEF MINISTER SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE IRRIGATION SCHEME
fields.schemeName: Chief Minister Sustainable Agriculture Irrigation Scheme - Magel Tyala Shettale (Individual Farm Pond)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme subsidy payable to individual farmer is minimum Rs.14433/- and maximum Rs.75000/- depending on the size of the farm pond.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Incentive for Marriage Between Differently Abled Person
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, an incentive of ₹2,00,000/- is provided, comprising ₹40,000 in cash and ₹1,60,000/- in the form of a National Savings Certificate (NSC), for the marriage between differently-abled individuals. The selection is periodical and depends on the availability of funds.

fields.schemeName: Aushadhi Avam Sugandhit Fasal Shetra Vistar
fields.briefDescription: Under the Scheme To increase production and productivity by expanding the area of ​​quality, high-yielding, short-duration medicinal and aromatic species.

fields.schemeName: Assistance to General Farmers for Installation of Submersible / Centrifugal Motor Pumpsets With Accessories
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, the farmers from the General Category are provided with a grant of 65% subsidy towards the installation of suitable Submersible / Centrifugal motor pump sets with accessories, subject to a maximum of ₹50,000/‐ per tubewell per individual.

fields.schemeName: Grant-in-Aid to Non-governmental Organisations Running Residential Homes for the Children, Aged, and Vulnerable Persons Under Social Defence
fields.briefDescription: “Grant-in-Aid to Non-governmental Organisations Running Residential Homes for the Children, Aged, and Vulnerable Persons Under Social Defence" was launched by Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry. NGOs are paid ₹ 500/- per month per inmates, in two equal installments, for 12 months.

fields.schemeName: 6 Varsh Se Adhik Aayu Ke Bahuviklang Aur Mansik Roop Se Aviksit Nisaktjan Ke Liye Sahayata Anudan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is M.P. To assist multiple handicapped and mentally underdeveloped persons above the age of six years who are unable to earn a living.

fields.schemeName: Samagra Samajik Suraksha Vridh Ashram Mai Nivaasarat Ant-vasi Pension Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, the Madhya Pradesh government provides financial support to the citizens who live in old age homes recognized by the Department of Social Justice.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Matrupushti Uphar
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Matrupushti Uphar” was launched by the Directorate of Social Welfare and Social Education, Government of Tripura, to provide financial assistance of ₹500/- to pregnant women through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) for antenatal checkups at any health facility.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Kalyakani Pension  Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under the Scheme, Every month financial assistance is provided to the Kalyani (widow) residing in the state for providing social security and subsistence.

fields.schemeName: State Medical Scholarship (Scholarship Scheme for MBBS & Allied Courses, Nursing and Paramedical Students)
fields.briefDescription: The “State Medical Scholarship” is a scholarship scheme, launched by the Department of Health & Family Welfare, Government of Nagaland. Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to students who are pursuing MBBS & Allied Courses, Nursing and Paramedical courses.

fields.schemeName: National Youth Award
fields.briefDescription: This award is to motivate young persons to achieve excellence in the field of national development or social service and to develop in them a sense of responsibility to the community and thus to improve their potential as good citizens.

fields.schemeName: "Design Development Training For Master Crafts Persons" Component of the "Development of Handicrafts" Scheme
fields.briefDescription: This scheme aims to enhance the skills of craftspersons in moulding and designing their traditional crafts. The objective is to make these crafts more appealing to customers and increase marketability. The training has a significant impact on the development of modern art and techniques in craft.

fields.schemeName: State Agriculture Thesis Grant for M.Sc. Agriculture
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “State Agriculture Thesis Grant for M.Sc. Agriculture” was launched by the Department of Agriculture, Government of Nagaland to provide a Thesis Grant to all the inhabitants of Nagaland who passed the M.Sc. Agriculture programme.

fields.schemeName: State Rice Mission Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to increase productivity and production of rice through improved technologies and extension methods and, to supply the quality/certified seeds/organic fertilizers at 50% subsidy.

fields.schemeName: Seed Testing Laboratory Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to assist seed testing services to farmers to ensure the viability and purity of seed to be sown.

fields.schemeName: "Reactivation Of Fisheries Cooperative Societies" Component of the "Mukhyamantri Maschyajibi Kalyan Yojana" Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the "Reactivation Of Fisheries Cooperative Societies" scheme is to provide a one-time revolving fund of ₹2,00,000/- to each eligible Primary Fishermen Cooperative Society for working capital of the society and improvement of the socio-economic status of the members in the long run.

fields.schemeName: Motivation of Unemployed Persons to Start Self-employed Enterprises
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Motivation of Unemployed Persons to Start Self-employed Enterprises” by the Dept of Industries and Commerce, UT of Puducherry was introduced to encourage self-employment among the youth in manufacturing and service activities, supporting the growing economy of Puducherry.

fields.schemeName: "Training in Handicrafts" Component of the "Development Of Handicrafts" Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Training in Handicrafts" Component of the "Development Of Handicrafts" Scheme by the Department of Industries and Commerce, Government of Puducherry, aims to create better employment opportunities and enhance the livelihood of the rural poor. The training adopts a Gurukulam model.

fields.schemeName: “Exposure Tour for the Coir Artisans” Component of the "Development of Coir" Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Exposure Tour For The Coir Artisans” by the Dept of Industries and Commerce, Union Territory of Puducherry is introduced for acquiring the latest techniques and innovative ideas in various coir units located in other states, the exposure tour will be conducted for the coir artisans.

fields.schemeName: Basic Agriculture Training Centre Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide short-term vocational training for rural educated unemployed youths in agriculture and allied sectors to develop entrepreneurship skills and employment generation.

fields.schemeName: Agriculture Academic Studies Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the Scheme is to sponsor students for undergoing 4 years of Graduate/degree courses in Agriculture/Horticulture against State quota seats in different Agriculture Universities in the country.

fields.schemeName: National Awards To Teachers (Higher Education)
fields.briefDescription: The purpose of National Awards to Teachers is to celebrate the unique contribution of some of the finest teachers in the country and to honor those teachers who through their commitment and industry have not only improved the quality of school education but also enriched the lives of their students.

fields.schemeName: "Advance / High Skill Training" Component of the "Development of Industries" Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to enhance the skill of those who have completed the basic training and are interested in advanced training in their trade or the candidates having technical qualifications willing to undergo some special high skilled training to start their ventures or to get suitable employment.

fields.schemeName: Farmers Training Institute Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide training to farmers at the village level on updated and innovative agriculture technology. The Training Institute facilitates exposure visits for farmers to agriculturally advanced states.

fields.schemeName: CHIEF MINISTER  EMPLOYMENT GENERATION  PROGRAMME (CMEGP)
fields.briefDescription: Government of Maharashtra has approved the introduction of a new credit linked subsidy program called Chief Minister Employment Generation Program(CMEGP) for generation of employment opportunities through establishment of Micro & Small Enterprises in rural as well as urban areas in state.

fields.schemeName: Prasuti Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Rajasthan Prasuti Sahayata Yojana is a scheme launched by the Government of Rajasthan to provide financial assistance to pregnant women from registered construction worker families in the state

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Award For Senior Citizens (vayoshreshtha Samman): Best Urban Local Body In Providing Services And Facilities To Senior Citizens
fields.briefDescription: The "Vayoshreshtha Samman: Best Urban Local Body in Providing Services and Facilities to Senior Citizens" award shall be given to municipal bodies, which have done outstanding work for senior citizens. The awards are conferred on 1st Oct by the Hon’ble President of India at Vigyan Bhawan, Delhi.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Award For Senior Citizens (Vayoshreshtha Samman): Best State In Implementing The Maintenance And Welfare Of Parents And Senior Citizens Act, 2007, And Providing Services And Facilities To Senior Citizens
fields.briefDescription: The "Vayoshreshtha Samman: Best State in Implementing the Maintenance and Welfare of Parents and Senior Citizens Act, 2007, and Providing Services and Facilities to Senior Citizens" award is given to the State/UT which has taken the lead in implementing various provisions of the act.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Award For Senior Citizens (Vayoshreshtha Samman): Best Public Sector Organisation In Promoting The Wellbeing And Welfare Of Senior Citizens
fields.briefDescription: The "Vayoshreshtha Samman: Best Private Sector Organisation in Promoting the Wellbeing and Welfare of Senior Citizens" award shall be given to the Public Sector Undertakings Undertaking Service to the Community Through Activities Under Corporate Social Responsibility, etc.

fields.nodalMinistryName: NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)
fields.schemeName: NITI Internship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: This Scheme seeks to engage students pursuing Under Graduate/Graduate/Post Graduate Degrees or are Research Scholars enrolled in recognized University/Institution within India or abroad, as "interns". They shall be given exposure to various Verticals/ Divisions/Units within NITI Aayog.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Award For Senior Citizens (vayoshreshtha Samman): Sports And Adventure
fields.briefDescription: The "Vayoshreshtha Samman: Sports and Adventure" award shall be given to senior citizens who have won international acclaim and who continue to contribute in the field of sports and adventure. The awards are conferred every year by the Hon’ble President of India at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi.

fields.schemeName: 'Financial Assistance for Setting Up of Sales Emporia by Industrial Associations, Handicrafts Societies and Recognized Institutions' under 'Marketing And Publicity'
fields.briefDescription: In this scheme, financial support will be provided via the Industrial Associations, Handicrafts Societies and Recognized Institutions for promotion of Handicrafts, Coir, Jute, Micro and Small Industrial products, i.e. for acquiring suitable buildings/premises & providing infrastructure facilities.

fields.schemeName: 'Grant-in-Aid to Industrial Association, CII, Industrial NGOs for Promotion of SME Clusters' under 'Marketing And Publicity'
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided to the Industrial Associations, CII, and Industrial NGOs for the promotion of the SME Cluster. The financial assistance is 75% of the actual cost, subject to a maximum of ₹3,00,000/- per unit in cluster.

fields.schemeName: Free Medical Card for Media Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides free medical facilities to press correspondents and members of their families in Government hospitals /institutions under the control of the Administration. This will include free treatment in Government hospitals /institutions with entitlement to A-Class Special Wards..

fields.schemeName: Swami Vivekananda Merit-cum-Means Scholarship
fields.briefDescription: "Swami Vivekananda Merit-cum-Means Scholarship" started by the Higher Education Department of West Bengal State for the financial assistance to the student.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Benefit (ANBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers maternity benefits to female employees registered as beneficiaries for one year during their maternity period. Additionally, male employees, registered for a year, with wives aged 19 or older and not beneficiaries, are also eligible for maternity benefits.

fields.schemeName: Pension Benefit (ANBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, pension shall be provided to the Building and Other Construction Workers who are registered under the A&N Islands Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board upon attaining the age of 55 years.

fields.schemeName: Medical Assistance (MBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to registered construction workers who are hospitalized for five or more days due to an accident or any disease.

fields.schemeName: Destitute Widow Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: 'Destitute Widow Pension Scheme' was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Dept, Tamil Nadu. A pension of ₹1,000 is provided to destitute widows who are 18 years and above in age. One free saree during Pongal and Deepavali and free rice in the Anganwadi Centres are also provided.

fields.schemeName: Laxman Award / Rani Laxmi Bai Award Scheme- Differently-abled and Posthumously
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Laxman Award/Rani Laxmi Bai Award” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttar Pradesh to honor special sports personalities of the state, differently-abled players and the Laxman Award, the highest sports award of the state will be given posthumously to Shahid.

fields.schemeName: Pension Scheme for Destitute Transgender
fields.briefDescription: The 'Pension Scheme for Destitute Transgender' was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to help poor transgender above 40 years of age who are unable to earn their livelihood.

fields.schemeName: Andaman & Nicobar Islands Scheme for Health Insurance
fields.briefDescription: The Health Insurance (ANISHI) shall provide cashless treatment upto Rupees 5 Lakhs per patients per illness which include indoor and outdoor treatments.

fields.schemeName: Family Pension (MBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: In the event of the death of a pensioner who was receiving a pension from the Board, a family pension shall be given to the surviving spouse by the Meghalaya Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWWB).

fields.schemeName: Nirmaan Sthal Par Karya Ke Dauran A-panjeekrat Shramik Ke Mratyu Ki Dasha Me Antyeshti  Evan Anugrah Rashi Bhugatan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: This scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the families of unregistered workers who die during construction work in Madhya Pradesh.

fields.schemeName: Nirman Shramik Avm Unke Aashrit Bacchon Dwara Bhartiya Rajasthan Prashasnik Seva Hetu Aayojit Pratibhabhik Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Labor department of Rajasthan started "Nirman Shramik Avm Unke Aashrit Bacchon Dwara Bhartiya Rajasthan Prashasnik Seva Hetu Aayojit Pratibhabhik Yojana" to help the children of construction workers.

fields.schemeName: Death Benefit (MBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, financial assistance shall be provided to the nominees or dependents of registered construction workers in the event of their natural or accidental death during the course of employment.

fields.schemeName: Pension To The Disabled Person
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the pension to the disabled person scheme is providing a pension to disabled persons is multifaceted, but generally centers around promoting social welfare, equity, and inclusivity.

fields.schemeName: Nirman Shramiko Ko Videsh Mai Rojgar Hetu Visa Per Hone Wale Vyay Ka Punarbharan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Labor department of Rajasthan started "Nirman Shramiko Ko Videsh Mai Rojgar Hetu Visa Per Hone Wale Vyay Ka Punarbharan Yojana" to help construction workers.

fields.schemeName: Riyaayati Dar Par Copies Ka Vitaran
fields.briefDescription: The Labor department of Madhya Pradesh state started the scheme "Riyaayati dar par Copies Ka Vitaran" for the children of construction worker.

fields.schemeName: Bed & Breakfast/Homestay Scheme- Punjab
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Bed & Breakfast/Homestay Scheme” is implemented by the Department of Tourism & Cultural Affairs, Government of Punjab with the aim of providing comfortable Bed & Breakfast (BnB)/Home Stay Facilities and supplementing the availability of accommodation across the State.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Assistance Scheme (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance during pregnancy to women construction workers and construction workers' wives registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board and to provide social stability to construction workers.

fields.schemeName: Funeral Assistance Scheme (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to the heir of a deceased construction worker registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board in case of death during the ongoing membership.

fields.schemeName: Relief under Natural Calamity / Pandemic Period (PBAOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The Board provides financial assistance of ₹ 2,000/- to the registered worker as a relief during a natural calamity/pandemic. The amount is credited through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) into the bank account of the registered construction worker. The applications are accepted offline.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Assistance Scheme (PBAOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The "Maternity Assistance" is a Welfare Scheme by the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. Through this scheme, the women employees who are beneficiary of the fund shall be given ₹5,000/- each as maternity benefit.

fields.schemeName: E.V.R. Maniammaiyar Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Daughter’s of Poor Widows: Scheme-I
fields.briefDescription: The 'E.V.R. Maniammaiyar Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Daughters of Poor Widows: Scheme-I' was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to help poor widow mothers by providing financial assistance for the marriage of their daughters.

fields.schemeName: Funeral Assistance Scheme (PBAOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The "Funeral Assistance" is a Welfare Scheme by the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. Through this scheme, the Board may sanction an amount of ₹7,000/- to the nominees/dependents of the deceased Construction Worker.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister’s Girl Child Protection Scheme-II
fields.briefDescription: The "Chief Minister’s Girl Child Protection Scheme-I" was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to girl children of poor families as well as to promote girl child education & eradicate female infanticide.

fields.schemeName: Cash Benefit Scheme Scheme (PBAOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the "Cash Benefit Scheme" is to provide educational financial assistance to the wards of construction workers who have secured the top three ranks at the State Level and Regional Level in the Higher Secondary course or its equivalent examinations. The amount is credited through DBT.

fields.schemeName: "Interest Subsidy" under "Motivation of Entrepreneurs to Start Industries and Fiscal Assistance to Industries"
fields.briefDescription: The industrial units which have availed loans from financial institutions towards the creation of fixed assets and for working capital shall be eligible for an interest incentive to an extent of 25% of the annual interest amount paid. The applications are accepted offline.

fields.schemeName: Go-Green Shramik Scheme (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, a one-time subsidy will be provided on the purchase of electric two-wheelers to construction workers who are registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board.

fields.schemeName: "SUPER 30" Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "Super 30" was launched by the Directorate of Secondary Education, Tripura. The scheme aims to provide free coaching for JEE/ NEET to the students who are appearing in the class 10th Board Final Exam and want to pursue Science Stream in Class 11th & 12th with the aspiration to crack JEE/NEET.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Giving Awards to Eminent Artists - Kalai Ilamani Award
fields.briefDescription: "Scheme of Giving Awards to Eminent Artists - Kalai Ilamani Award" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu aims to promote and preserve the culture of Tamil Nadu. The selected artists are awarded financial assistance ₹4,000/- and certificates of appreciation.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Giving Awards to Eminent Artists - Kalai Sudarmani Award
fields.briefDescription: "Scheme of Giving Awards to Eminent Artists - Kalai Sudarmani Award" by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu aims to promote and preserve the culture of Tamil Nadu. The selected artists are awarded financial assistance ₹10,000/- and certificates of appreciation.

fields.schemeName: Deepawali Cash Gift Scheme (PULWS)
fields.briefDescription: The Puducherry Unorganised Labourers' Welfare Society extends ₹500/- to the Unorganised Workers as a Cash Gift during the festival of Diwali. The amount is credited through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) into the bank account of the worker. The applications are accepted offline.

fields.schemeName: Haryana Provision of Sports Equipment Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "Haryana Provision of Sports Equipment Scheme" by the Sports Dept, Government of Haryana provides sports equipment to Gram Panchayats and Municipal bodies to encourage youngsters in the state towards sports such as Volleyball, Football, Basketball, Handball, Boxing, Wrestling, Judo, Cricket, etc.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Konya Atmonirbhor Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The State Government has launched a scheme "Mukhyamantri Konya Atmonirbhor Yojana". The objective of the scheme is to provide a free Scooty to the meritorious girl students which will be useful for them to travel to their College.
